verdict.summary: Function or variable not defined in the current package or not exported (lowercase first letter).

dead_ends.action: Adding the function to a different package without importing
dead_ends.why_fails: Go requires explicit imports between packages

dead_ends.action: Using go:linkname to access unexported symbols
dead_ends.why_fails: Compiler hack; breaks with Go version updates

workarounds.action: Ensure the function starts with uppercase to be exported: MyFunc not myFunc
workarounds.how: Only uppercase-initial identifiers are exported in Go

workarounds.action: Check build tags and file suffixes (_test.go, _linux.go) that may exclude the file
workarounds.how: Files with build constraints may not be compiled in your environment

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'undefined' indicates a reference to an undefined identifier, while 'json' indicates a JSON unmarshal type mismatch.
'undefined' indicates a reference to an undefined identifier, while 'error' indicates all goroutines blocked (deadlock).
